column1: Kampong Thom (Khmer: ក្រុងកំពង់ធំ; Krong Kampong Thom
column2: "Grand Port") is the capital city of Kampong Thom Province
column3: Cambodia lying on the bank of the Steung Saen River. It is a mid-way stopover on the National Highway No 6 halfway between Phnom Penh and Siem Reap.The Kampong Thom High School is North of the river bridge
column4: and the Kampong Thom Market is on the south side of the bridge
column5: followed by the main street and dual carriageway. Further south along the road is Steung Saen City (Khmer: ក្រុងស្ទឹងសែន krong steungsaen) also a district in Kampong Thom Province and a side road to the Floating Pagoda (វត្ត ក្ដីអណ្ដែត).

column1: One of Kampong Thom's landmarks is a roundabout with a statue of an elephant fighting two tigers.
